env-entry.description:
The URI of the XML to configure the mandatory local Maven repository and the optional remote Maven repositories to use for the artifact resolution, encoded as a string.
If the decoded URI is absolute (i.e. if it has a scheme component), then the URI gets converted to a URL and the XML gets loaded from this URL. E.g. "file:///directory/repositories.xml".
Otherwise, the URI is considered to specify the name of a resource on the class path and the XML gets loaded from this resource. E.g. "package/repositories.xml".
In either case, if the string contains references of the form \${key}, then they get replaced with the value of the system property with the specified key. E.g. "file://\${user.home}/.repositories.xml".
The default value refers to a resource on the class path which contains the XML to configure the local repository path "${user.home}/.m2/repository" - thus referencing the home directory of the user which runs the web app server - plus the Maven Central URL "http://repo1.maven.org/maven2/" as the repositories to use for the artifact resolution.
